title: So apparently the marksman rework is coming after the Fighters. I've got some questions about that.
body:
Are we finally changing how marksmen apparently increase their damage by duct taping an Infinity Edge to their guns?

Are the marksmen finally going to learn that it is better to use a knife than a freaking longbow while in hand to hand combat?

Will Ezreal still have no need of a map?

replies.body:
> Are we finally changing how marksmen apparently increase their damage by duct taping an Infinity Edge to their guns?

> Are the marksmen finally going to learn that it is better to use a knife than a freaking longbow while in hand to hand combat?

> Will Ezreal still have no need of a map?

Marksmens' identities are closely intertwined with tying swords to their guns and bows; I wouldn't expect this to change. Marksmen are also all strong believers of not bringing knives to gunfights, and to them, all fights are gunfights.

Per this suggestion, if and when we ever get to do some work on Ezreal, his minimap will be disabled, but his sight radius doubled.

Will we see more diversified adc or 'marksmen' builds?
And will you address this problem adc's find when force to back early and are gold starved?

> [{quoted}](name=Sylvrd1,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=NNqbXMfl,comment-id=00070001,timestamp=2015-08-15T21:16:51.258+0000)
>
> And will you address this problem adc's find when force to back early and are gold starved?

That's not an ADC problem mate, that's a player skill problem.
Ouch

> [{quoted}](name=Archenz,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=NNqbXMfl,comment-id=0007000100000000,timestamp=2015-08-15T21:29:49.589+0000)
>
> Ouch

Sorry but it's true. I main ADC and the only time I'm being "gold starved" is when I'm getting out-harassed/outplayed in lane. The ADC role itself isn't making you not farm, it's a lack of lane presence and aggression.

I'm a jungle main, I honestly couldn't care less. I just felt bad for him xD, my feelings were fine.

But really, if the jungler is behind, we just afk farm and we k. But I would guess its harder for the adc.

Edit: just let your support be SORAKA and you never have to back

I just watched LGD knock EDG out of the semi-finals of the LPL 3-0.  I wish you could have been in there instead of Deft because never having to go back before buying a {{item:1038}} is a tremendous advantage.  That probably would have made a huge difference when facing Imp later in the game.

Made you should fill out your application for the pros, they could sure use you.

I think he's addressing the limited builds you can make with Long Sword, most of the first items ADC's make besides BotRK require a BF Sword, currently the most expensive single component (since the change to NLR), so getting forced out of lane at 1400~ gold means you're either forced to delay your build and go for t2 boots/pickaxe (if going IE) or you're playing someone who can use Triforce/BotRK.

Re-adjusting BF Sword similarly to how they did NLR and creating a few more options would give way more choice and timing opportunities.

> That's not an ADC problem mate, that's a player skill problem.

I wouldnt say that, only one of the two adc's can win lane. And if their jungle constantlycamp you and yours doesnt help making you unable to farm safely thus losing lane, does that mean you los because of skill?
Yea, you lost because the other team played better, and forced you to not farm.
No I typically lose lane as ADC cause I suck ass and my support cant carry a guy whose last hitting mechanics are on par with a physically challenged lobster.

Are the marksman changes going to do away with crit? I always found it weird that you guys did away with other rpg stats like dodge/parry, but losing a fight because the adc just happen to crit you twice is kinda lame.

Do you think crits (rng) have a place in a competitive game?

They like crit because that chance gives the ADC some chance to beat a mage in a 1v1. They would still do more damage overall, but they could ever outburst anyone. If anything, it's a defensive mechanic because it gives them a scare factor that they wouldn't otherwise have.

Dodge was removed because dodging didn't feel awesome, and being dodged felt terrible.

Being crit sucks but getting a big crit feels amazing.

Muh uniqueness!

On a serious note I'd like to know if and how much (in terms of what you or others can say) is going to change {{champion:110}}. I started playing him midlane and it's even more fun than botlane. I do believe that some things might be done in terms of QoL but I'd like to hear what your plans are. Also, is the MM change going also through a change of items?

On a Varus note, I already love him he's the adc I turn to, but if he was to receive the Ashe treatment (move w to passive and grab a different skill) he would be great!! I love his immobile long range style, but I feel some tweaks (maybe a VU? :D) could emphasize this.
Hi, Repertoir. I can't help but notice it's Saturday. Don't you take days off?

This is very nice! I just hope that you won't hurt Vayne too much in the process. I think she already has a very distinctive playstyle and she is very fun to play.

PS 
You said marksmen don't like knives, but Valor is using his claws. This is wrong. I believe he should launch eggs instead. This would both make much more sense and be more thematically relevant.

Actually. Infinity edge is not a sword. It is an enchantment. There is an oasis in the Shuriman desert that has magical water. Weapons dipped into the water gain an edge so sharp, they are said to have an "infinity edge".

Basically, Marksmen sharpen their projectiles with magical shuriman desert water.
*MIND BLOWN*
{{champion:222}} : How does that even work on bullets?
Think a deep fryer but instead of oil its magic water... And instead of delicious food its a shit ton of bullets.

oh i feel dumb

I kind of wish the items interacted with one another more.
For example, the lightning effect from {{item:3087}} .
Just an interesting and low-key feature, make it change colors based on other items.
{{item:3072}} Red lightning
{{item:3153}} Purple lightning
{{item:3508}} Blue lightning

There's just such an opportunity to make some neat interactions for more attractive gameplay- you'd get a greater feeling from buying items- though the word escapes me at the moment.
Look at {{item:3025}} - conjures up a field of ice!
{{item:3751}} What about a field of fire?
{{item:3074}} A blow that cracks the ground?
{{item:3087}} A circle of electricity?

It could be done with {{item:3116}} as well!
{{item:3151}} Trails of poison instead of ice!
{{item:3285}} Purple ice trail!

Even {{item:3075}}  could join the party!
{{item:3068}} Burst of flame hits the enemy the damage is reflecting to.
{{item:3110}} Icy crystals for the same!

They don't have to be massive complex or flashy changes, just let me feel like buying an item does something besides boost my numbers; let me feel like I'm really growing in power. My autoattacks look the same at level 18 as they do at level 1!

I personally believe that rushing Ravenous Hydra, Runan's Hurricane, and 4 Sunfire Capes, is the best way to maximize damage potential.

i just want draaaaven to be throwing infinity edges.

Ooooo, i wonder which champions are going to be hit first with the rework. We can probably guess where it would be headed if we look at the Ashe, MF, and Trist. reworks. Looks like they want to reward players by having them get in a few AA to strengthen their abilities.** So are we gonna see a huge shift in ability dependent Adcs (Lucian, Quin, Corki, ect). **

That would be interesting to see. Maybe Taric's rework will reflect this new change of the adc's.
Where did you get this information that, indeed the marksman rework is coming soon?

My biggest request is for RNGesus to be removed from the game with the last RNG/pseudo RNG factor of crit chance being removed.

No more triple tryn crits for 140 damage at level 2 giving him an easy lane to win even against a Nasus who bought armor to start.

Instead of the current crit system something like "Weapon Experties" making all autos do 10% more of total AD instead of 10% chance to do double damage would make for a much more skill based match up vs the likes of Tryn so he isn't sometimes winning when he is getting attacked by 8 minions and the enemy champ because he for a string of crits.

The unpredictability of the game should be on the choices of the players, not based on something that is out of the players hands happening or not.
Ezreal will never need a map, map awareness is the support's job... kappa

They should remove all AD assassins from the game first.

THEN Marksmen will have a chance at getting balanced around items. 

As much as I like all the AD assassins' playstyles, potent AD scalings on abilities warps AD itemization. 

Not to mention that AD assassins take advantage of critical strikes (and its RNG component) much more than actual ADCs.
